conclusion: Understanding the problem involves two harmonic transverse waves propagating in opposite directions.
Consideration of the dynamic characteristics of harmonic transverse waves propagating in positive and negative directions.
Exploration of the propagation characteristics of harmonic transverse waves.
Analysis of the propagation characteristics of harmonic transverse waves.
Wave sources are located at x = -0.2 m and x = 1.2 m, with both waves having a wave speed of 0.4 m/s and an amplitude of 2 m.
Particles P, M, and Q are located at x = 0.2 m, x = 0.5 m, and x = 0.8 m respectively at t = 0.
Equation of motion for a harmonic wave is y(x,t) = A sin(kx - ωt + φ).
Wave number k and angular frequency ω are related to wave speed v by k = ω/v.
For the right-moving wave, position at time t is x1 = -0.2 + 0.4t.
For the left-moving wave, position at time t is x2 = 1.2 - 0.4t.
The two waves meet at t = 1.75 seconds.
